title: Vietcap dự báo lợi nhuận ròng 2024 của Vinamilk có thể tăng trưởng 2 con số lên trên 10.000 tỷ
summary: Vinamilk (VNM) dự báo có kết quả kinh doanh quý II 2024 đột phá, doanh thu tăng 10% đạt 16.656 tỷ đồng, lợi nhuận sau thuế tăng 21% lên gần 2.700 tỷ đồng, mức cao nhất trong 11 quý.  Vietcap dự báo lợi nhuận ròng 2024 của Vinamilk có thể tăng trưởng 2 con số, lên trên 10.000 tỷ đồng, cao hơn kế hoạch và là mức cao nhất trong vòng 3 năm.  Nguyên nhân chính là do tăng trưởng mạnh ở thị trường nước ngoài (dự kiến tăng 18% trong năm 2024, với xuất khẩu tăng 21%), cải thiện biên lợi nhuận gộp (tăng thêm 240-340 điểm cơ bản), và sự thành công trong marketing, đặc biệt tại Iraq.  Vietcap cũng dự báo doanh thu thuần 2024 của Vinamilk sẽ đạt gần 64.500 tỷ đồng, tăng 7%.  Sự khởi sắc này đã thu hút dòng vốn đầu tư nước ngoài trở lại, mua ròng hơn 34 triệu cổ phiếu VNM, đẩy giá cổ phiếu tăng gần 13% trong một tháng qua.  Vinamilk cũng sẽ chi trả cổ tức cho cổ đông với tỷ lệ 9,5% và tạm ứng cổ tức đợt 1/2024 với tỷ lệ 15%, tổng cộng hơn 5.120 tỷ đồng.

title: "Trùm" bán nguyên liệu cho Vinamilk, Masan, Unilever đẩy mạnh mua cổ phần "Vua nha đam" GC Food
summary: Công ty Nguyên liệu Á Châu AIG (AIG), một nhà cung cấp nguyên liệu cho các doanh nghiệp sản xuất thực phẩm lớn như Vinamilk, Masan, và Unilever, đã tăng đáng kể sở hữu cổ phần tại GC Food ("vua nha đam"), từ 14,1% lên 28,07%.  AIG mua gần 4,3 triệu cổ phiếu GCF với giá bình quân khoảng 23.400 đồng/cp,  trong một thương vụ ước tính hơn 100 tỷ đồng.  Sự kiện này diễn ra cùng lúc với việc GC Food giải thể công ty con Công nghệ Pura và đang đặt mục tiêu doanh thu 573 tỷ đồng (tăng 21%) và lợi nhuận sau thuế hơn 52 tỷ đồng (tăng gần gấp đôi) trong năm 2024.  Việc AIG trở thành cổ đông lớn của GC Food có thể củng cố chiến lược kinh doanh của công ty này, đặc biệt trong bối cảnh AIG cung cấp nguyên liệu cho các đối tác lớn trong ngành thực phẩm.  Giá cổ phiếu GCF đã tăng mạnh trong tháng 5 nhưng hiện đã giảm trở lại.

title: Danh mục đầu tư 9 tỷ USD của 1 DN Nhà nước: Một nửa để gửi ngân hàng, mua hơn 1 tỷ USD trái phiếu doanh nghiệp, đổ vào cổ phiếu ACB, VNM, VCB
summary: Bảo Việt, một tập đoàn bảo hiểm nhà nước, đang quản lý danh mục đầu tư trị giá 9 tỷ USD, trong đó 52% (hơn 113.700 tỷ đồng) được gửi tiết kiệm ngân hàng, một kênh an toàn và sinh lời ổn định.  Hơn 1 tỷ USD được đầu tư vào trái phiếu doanh nghiệp và trái phiếu Chính phủ, với lãi suất từ 5,78% đến 7,23%.  Ngoài ra, Bảo Việt cũng đầu tư vào chứng khoán, bao gồm cổ phiếu của các công ty lớn như ACB, VNM, và VCB.  Tuy nhiên, giá trị danh mục cổ phiếu này hiện thấp hơn giá gốc, cho thấy có thể vẫn đang lỗ.  Lợi nhuận trước thuế của Bảo Việt trong quý 3/2024 đạt 688 tỷ đồng, tăng 26% so với cùng kỳ năm trước, là kết quả tích cực trong bối cảnh nhiều doanh nghiệp khác gặp khó khăn do ảnh hưởng của bão.

title: Vinamilk yêu cầu gì khi tuyển dụng vị trí từng có tỷ lệ chọi 1:150, 'khắc nghiệt' hơn vào FTU, NEU: Mức lương mới thực sự là ẩn số?
summary: Vinamilk đang tuyển dụng nhiều vị trí Marketing, với tỷ lệ chọi lên tới 1:150, cao hơn nhiều so với các trường đại học hàng đầu.  Yêu cầu tuyển dụng bao gồm tốt nghiệp đại học, 2 năm kinh nghiệm marketing, 1 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí tương đương tại công ty lớn trong ngành sữa/thực phẩm nhanh, và một loạt kỹ năng như lên kế hoạch, triển khai, giao tiếp, đàm phán, thuyết trình, giải quyết vấn đề, làm việc nhóm, tiếng Anh tốt, và khả năng chịu áp lực. Tuy nhiên, mức lương cụ thể không được công khai.  Vinamilk, nổi tiếng với chi phí quảng cáo lớn, vẫn đầu tư mạnh mẽ vào hoạt động này, thể hiện qua việc thay đổi bộ nhận diện thương hiệu mới, và vẫn giữ vị trí hàng đầu trong ngành sữa Việt Nam.

title: Khối ngoại mạnh tay mua ròng cổ phiếu VNM, vốn hóa Vinamilk trở lại top 10 sàn chứng khoán
summary: Cổ phiếu VNM của Vinamilk tăng mạnh gần 16% trong tháng qua, vượt qua Vingroup trở lại top 10 doanh nghiệp giá trị nhất sàn chứng khoán Việt Nam với vốn hóa xấp xỉ 160.000 tỷ đồng.  Sự hồi phục này được thúc đẩy bởi dòng vốn đầu tư nước ngoài mua ròng hơn 33 triệu cổ phiếu VNM trong hai tháng qua,  phần nào phản ánh kết quả kinh doanh quý II vượt trội của Vinamilk. Doanh thu thuần đạt 16.656 tỷ đồng, tăng gần 10% so với cùng kỳ năm ngoái, mức cao nhất kể từ đầu năm 2022. Lợi nhuận sau thuế cũng tăng 21% lên gần 2.700 tỷ đồng.  Tăng trưởng xuất khẩu, cải thiện biên lợi nhuận gộp và chiến lược tái định vị thương hiệu năm 2023 được cho là các yếu tố chính.  Phân tích của các nhà đầu tư cho thấy Vinamilk dự kiến tăng trưởng doanh thu trong nước và xuất khẩu trong năm 2024, dự án "Tổ hợp chăn nuôi và chế biến thịt bò Vinabeef" sẽ đem lại doanh thu đáng kể trong tương lai.

title: Vinamilk đặt mục tiêu phá kỷ lục doanh thu, dự chi hơn 8.000 tỷ cổ tức cho năm 2024
summary: Vinamilk đặt mục tiêu doanh thu 63.163 tỷ đồng và lợi nhuận sau thuế 9.376 tỷ đồng trong năm 2024,  tăng nhẹ so với năm 2023.  Đây là mục tiêu nhằm phá vỡ kỷ lục doanh thu năm 2021.  Công ty dự kiến chi trả cổ tức hơn 8.000 tỷ đồng, chiếm khoảng 95% lợi nhuận năm nay, tương đương tỷ lệ 38,5% (01 cổ phiếu nhận 3.850 đồng).  Số tiền cổ tức này sẽ được chia cho các cổ đông lớn như SCIC (36% vốn), nhóm F&N (20,4% vốn) và Platinum Victory Pte. Ptd (10,62% vốn).  Kết quả kinh doanh năm 2023 của Vinamilk cũng rất tốt, đạt doanh thu 60.479 tỷ đồng và lợi nhuận sau thuế 9.019 tỷ đồng, vượt kế hoạch đề ra.

title: Đối tác không thể thiếu của Unilever, Acecook, Trung Nguyên, Vinamilk vừa báo lãi kỷ lục, chuẩn bị trả cổ tức tiền mặt "khủng" 35.000 đồng/cp
summary: Bao bì Nhựa Tân Tiến (TTP) vừa công bố cổ tức tiền mặt kỷ lục 35.000 đồng/cổ phiếu cho năm 2023, tương đương tỷ lệ 350%.  Đây là mức cổ tức cao kỷ lục so với các năm trước.  Mặc dù doanh thu năm 2023 giảm 10% xuống 1.734 tỷ đồng do cạnh tranh, nhưng lợi nhuận sau thuế tăng mạnh 233% lên 153 tỷ đồng.  Công ty dự kiến doanh thu 1.944 tỷ đồng và lợi nhuận trước thuế 223 tỷ đồng trong năm 2024, tăng 14% so với năm 2023.  Tân Tiến là nhà cung cấp bao bì cho các công ty lớn như Unilever, Acecook, Trung Nguyên, và Vinamilk.  Cổ đông lớn của công ty là Dongwon Systems Corporation của Hàn Quốc.  Giá cổ phiếu TTP đã tăng gần gấp đôi trong năm nay lên mức 110.000 đồng/cp.

title: WeChoice Award 2023: Vinamilk đạt bước ngoặt lớn khi vượt qua “cái bóng của chính mình”, bứt phá dẫn đầu trong Hạng mục Đơn Vị Vươn Mình Rực Rỡ
summary: Vinamilk dẫn đầu hạng mục "Đơn vị Vươn mình rực rỡ" tại WeChoice Awards 2023 với 23.016 lượt bình chọn, vượt qua "cái bóng của chính mình" bằng việc thay đổi bộ nhận diện thương hiệu.  Năm 2023, Vinamilk cũng công bố lộ trình Net Zero 2050, thể hiện sự tiên phong trong việc thực hiện cam kết của chính phủ Việt Nam.  Các thương hiệu khác được đề cử bao gồm mì thanh long Caty (vị trí thứ 2), Nhà mạng Saymee (vị trí thứ 3), và một số thương hiệu khác trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm và dịch vụ.  WeChoice Awards 2023 vinh danh những đơn vị có những bước ngoặt đáng nhớ trong năm 2023.

title: Thêm 1 doanh nghiệp trị giá 10.000 tỷ sắp lên sàn: Chủ tịch sở hữu khối tài sản hơn 3.000 tỷ, doanh thu hơn chục nghìn tỷ mỗi năm từ bán nguyên liệu cho Vinamilk, Masan, Trung Nguyên
summary: Công ty Nguyên liệu Á Châu (AIG) niêm yết trên UPCoM với mã chứng khoán AIG, với vốn hóa khoảng 10.748 tỷ đồng.  Đây là một doanh nghiệp cung cấp nguyên liệu cho các thương hiệu lớn như Vinamilk, Masan, Trung Nguyên.  Doanh thu của AIG trong quý 3/2024 đạt 3.112 tỷ đồng, tăng 7% so với cùng kỳ và lợi nhuận sau thuế đạt 203 tỷ đồng, tăng gần 10%.  Lũy kế 9 tháng đầu năm, doanh thu đạt 8.891 tỷ đồng, lợi nhuận sau thuế đạt 634 tỷ đồng.  Chủ tịch và Tổng giám đốc AIG đều sở hữu khối tài sản lớn từ cổ phần của công ty, với giá trị chứng khoán lần lượt là hơn 3.258 tỷ đồng và gần 912 tỷ đồng.  Công ty đặt kế hoạch doanh thu gần 12.950 tỷ đồng và lợi nhuận sau thuế gần 890 tỷ đồng trong năm nay.

title: Liên tục đăng ký mua cổ phiếu Vinamilk rồi “hủy kèo”, tỉ phú Thái Lan và cá mập Singapore đang suy tính gì?
summary: Các nhà đầu tư nước ngoài, cụ thể là Platinum Victory Pte.Ltd (Singapore) và quỹ của tỷ phú Thái Lan Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, liên tục đăng ký mua cổ phiếu Vinamilk (VNM) nhưng không thành công.  Đây là lần thứ 6 Platinum Victory đăng ký nhưng không mua được, và lần thứ 5 của quỹ tỷ phú Thái Lan.  Mặc dù không mua được, sự quan tâm của các quỹ này diễn ra trong bối cảnh cổ phiếu VNM tăng mạnh sau thời gian đi ngang, đạt mức cao gần 74.000 đồng/cổ phiếu.  Kết quả kinh doanh quý II/2024 của Vinamilk rất khả quan, với doanh thu thuần gần 16.700 tỷ đồng và lợi nhuận sau thuế 2.695 tỷ đồng, tăng trưởng mạnh mẽ và giành thêm 1,2% thị phần.  Dự báo cho cả năm, doanh thu và lợi nhuận ròng của Vinamilk vẫn được dự báo tăng trưởng tốt, và cổ phiếu VNM được kỳ vọng hưởng lợi từ việc FTSE Russell nâng hạng thị trường Việt Nam.

title: Đại diện Vinamilk: Sữa Việt Nam sẵn sàng tham gia chuỗi bán lẻ toàn cầu
summary: Vinamilk đang tích cực mở rộng thị trường xuất khẩu, tham gia vào các chuỗi bán lẻ toàn cầu tại Vietnam International Sourcing Expo 2024.  Công ty nhận được sự quan tâm từ các chuỗi bán lẻ lớn như Walmart, Aeon, Woolworths, và nhiều đối tác từ các khu vực như châu Phi, Nhật Bản, Đông Nam Á, Nam Mỹ.  Vinamilk đã có 25 năm kinh nghiệm xuất khẩu và đã hiện diện ở 60 quốc gia.  Sự mạnh mẽ trong sản xuất quy mô lớn, chất lượng sản phẩm và việc đáp ứng tiêu chuẩn bền vững (đã có 3 đơn vị trung hòa carbon) là những yếu tố quan trọng giúp Vinamilk cạnh tranh thành công.  Công ty tin tưởng rằng, với những nỗ lực này, sữa Việt Nam sẽ ngày càng có chỗ đứng trong các chuỗi cung ứng toàn cầu.

title: Vinamilk: Doanh thu thị trường nước ngoài tăng 15,7%, xuất khẩu tiếp tục là "lực đẩy"
summary: Vinamilk's international market revenue increased by 15.7% in Q3 2024, driven by a 10.3% rise in exports and an 8.5% increase in overseas branch sales.  This strong performance continues the company's five consecutive quarters of positive growth in overseas markets, contributing significantly to overall revenue.  Vinamilk is focusing on emerging markets, utilizing free trade agreements, and strategic partnerships to expand its export reach to regions like Australia, South America, and Africa.  New product offerings, such as Vinamilk Cocofresh coconut water, are being introduced in key international markets to further diversify its product portfolio.  Improvements in product packaging, including a focus on lower sugar options, and diversification of product flavors are also being rolled out to meet evolving consumer trends.  Domestic sales, while facing headwinds from Typhoon Yagi, still saw a 3.3% increase in revenue, indicating continued strong performance overall.  The company is maintaining its full-year revenue target of 63.163 trillion VND.  Furthermore, Vinamilk's international expansion is facilitated by the listing of its derivative product, VNM19, on the Thai stock exchange, offering greater access to international investors.

title: VDSC: "Ông lớn" hàng tiêu dùng thiết yếu Vinamilk, Masan đang ở vị thế thuận lợi để duy trì đà tăng trưởng giai đoạn cuối năm
summary: VDSC, a brokerage firm, believes major consumer staples companies like Vinamilk (VNM) and Masan Consumer Holdings (MCH) are well-positioned to maintain growth in the second half of 2024, despite a generally negative trend in the sector.  Positive factors include effective marketing strategies, increased promotions, and expanded distribution channels, helping to boost market share both domestically and internationally for these companies.  Vinamilk's revamped packaging and marketing campaigns, along with increased promotions, are cited as key drivers of growth, while Masan's expanded WinMart network and targeted sales strategies are also highlighted. While growth is anticipated, it's projected to be moderate rather than substantial.  Factors like a recovering domestic consumer market due to wage adjustments and better export performance support this view.  However, headwinds remain, including continued sluggishness in major international markets (US, Europe) affecting domestic production and employment, as well as the ongoing property market slowdown.  VDSC expects moderate, not spectacular, growth in domestic sales for these giants.

title: Một tập đoàn tại Việt Nam gia nhập 'CLB tỷ USD', chung mâm với loạt ông lớn FPT, Vinamilk, Vinhomes
summary: Tập đoàn Bảo Việt (BVH) đã đạt doanh thu hợp nhất 28.030 tỷ đồng trong nửa đầu năm 2024, tương đương 1,1 tỷ USD, đưa công ty vào "CLB tỷ USD" cùng các tập đoàn lớn khác như FPT, Vinamilk, Vinhomes. Lợi nhuận trước thuế và sau thuế cũng tăng trưởng đáng kể, đạt lần lượt 1.276 tỷ đồng và 1.059 tỷ đồng, tăng 9,6% và 9,4% so với cùng kỳ năm ngoái.  Các mảng kinh doanh chính đều ghi nhận tăng trưởng tích cực, đặc biệt là bảo hiểm nhân thọ với tăng trưởng 19,9% lợi nhuận sau thuế.  Công ty Chứng khoán Bảo Việt (BVSC) cũng có tăng trưởng ấn tượng về doanh thu và lợi nhuận.  Năm nay, Bảo Việt dự kiến chi hơn 745 tỷ đồng cho cổ tức bằng tiền mặt.

title: 2 ông lớn đầu ngành FMCG Vinamilk và mỳ Hảo Hảo bất ngờ "chung sân"
summary: Vinamilk and Hảo Hảo, two major FMCG brands, were nominated for the "Outstanding Achievement" category at the WeChoice Awards 2023.  Vinamilk, despite facing challenges like a saturated market and rising input costs, saw positive growth in Q3 2023, with a record profit of 2.492 trillion VND.  This turnaround is attributed to a new brand identity and digital transformation strategy.  Hảo Hảo, a leading instant noodle brand, maintained its dominant position in the Vietnamese market, achieving a record of top sales and brand recognition.  Both companies have demonstrated resilience in a challenging market, with Hảo Hảo achieving substantial growth in its noodle sales in 2023 despite overall market declines.  Both companies also engaged in significant social activities, such as  promotions and giving out Tết gifts.

title: Các “doanh nghiệp dân tộc” Viettel, PVN, Vingroup, FPT, THACO, Hòa Phát, TH, Vinamilk, Masan… đóng góp lớn vào thương hiệu quốc gia
summary: At a meeting with Vietnamese business leaders, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính praised the significant contributions of Vietnamese businesses, including Viettel, PVN, Vingroup, FPT, THACO, Hòa Phát, TH, Vinamilk, and Masan, to national branding.  The PM highlighted their strong growth, technological advancements, and social responsibility, particularly in the face of recent economic challenges.  He emphasized the need for a supportive government environment, infrastructure development, and human capital investment to further boost the country's economic progress.  The meeting focused on strategies for sustainable economic growth, including technological innovation, infrastructure improvements, and social responsibility initiatives.  Key takeaways included the substantial growth in new business formations, the diverse presence of businesses across various sectors, and the commitment of the business community to overcoming economic challenges and contributing to national development.

title: Vinamilk hỗ trợ gần 3 tỷ đồng sản phẩm dinh dưỡng thiết yếu cho 10 tỉnh thành ảnh hưởng bão lũ
summary: Vinamilk donated over 550,000 units of essential nutritional products (milk, dairy products, etc.) valued at nearly 3 billion VND to 10 northern provinces affected by Typhoon Yagi and subsequent flooding.  This aid included milk, dairy products, and drinks, focusing on areas heavily impacted by the storm.  The donations were delivered via various channels, including direct assistance to vulnerable communities, particularly children, and to local authorities managing relief efforts. Vinamilk's response focused on providing vital sustenance to those in need, recognizing the critical role of essential nutrition during such crises.

title: Chỉ còn 1 ngày để bình chọn, Conteccons bất ngờ vượt Vinamilk, vươn lên "vị trí số 1" Hạng mục Đơn Vị Vươn Mình Rực Rỡ tại WeChoie Award 2023
summary: Coteccons, a construction company, unexpectedly surpassed Vinamilk to take the top spot in the "Outstanding Achievement" category of the WeChoice Awards 2023.  Coteccons' strong performance, including winning a large LEGO factory construction project, and subsequent positive financial results (five consecutive quarters of improved profits, including a record high in Q3 2023), are key factors in their surge in the voting.  The company is also expanding into international markets.  Despite a challenging period for the construction sector, including a decline in the real estate market, Coteccons' success highlights their resilience and ability to secure large projects.  Their stock price also saw a significant increase, almost tripling compared to the start of the year.

title: Top 50 công ty niêm yết lớn nhất của Forbes gọi tên Big4 Ngân hàng, Vinamilk, Hòa Phát, Vietjet Air...
summary: Forbes Vietnam named the top 50 listed companies in 2024 based on 2023 financial reports.  The list prominently features the Big 4 banks (Vietcombank, Vietinbank, BIDV, and Bảo Việt), along with technology leader FPT, airline Vietjet Air, and consumer staple giant Vinamilk.  While the top three listed companies are in the energy and steel sectors (PV GAS, Hòa Phát, Petrolimex),  the banking sector stands out with high profits despite moderate revenues.  Vinamilk, the fourth largest in terms of revenue, reported 60.3 trillion VND in revenue and 8.8 trillion VND in profit.  Overall, the list showcases the strength and diversity of Vietnam's publicly traded companies.

title: ĐHĐCĐ Vinamilk: Quý 1/2024 lợi nhuận tăng trưởng 16%
summary: Vinamilk's Q1 2024 performance saw a 16% increase in profit compared to the same period last year.  The company maintained a strong commitment to dividend payouts, aiming for a 38.5% dividend payout ratio (equivalent to 3,850 VND per share) in 2024.  While the overall dairy market in Vietnam experienced a decline in milk powder sales, Vinamilk reported positive growth in key product segments like yogurt, fresh milk, and condensed milk.  The company's efforts to reposition its brand identity, particularly in the dairy beverage sector, are seen as contributing to the positive Q1 results and a projected 2.8% increase in market share for the product segment following the repositioning.  Future growth strategies include ongoing international expansion and development of new projects such as the Vinabeef meat processing plant, although some projects, such as the Thiên đường Sữa Mộc Châu dairy farm project, are facing challenges regarding land use permits.

title: Cổ phiếu VHM vượt mốc 40.000 đồng, vốn hóa của Vinhomes đã tăng gần 1 tỷ USD sau khi công bố thương vụ 'lớn chưa từng có', vượt Hòa Phát, Vinamilk hay Techcombank
summary: Vinhomes' stock price (VHM) surpassed 40,000 VND, boosting its market capitalization to nearly 1 billion USD, following the announcement of a significant share buyback program.  The company plans to purchase 370 million shares, equivalent to 8.5% of its outstanding shares, which will decrease its share capital.  This move, along with positive revenue projections from ongoing and upcoming projects, is driving investor confidence.  Analysts at ABS (An Bình Securities) see a positive outlook for Vinhomes in the second half of 2024, emphasizing high unsold inventory, planned launches of large-scale projects (like Vinhomes Ocean Park 3, Sky Park, and Golden Avenue), and the potential for future development in multiple locations across Vietnam. The anticipated benefits from recent land use legislation for real estate development are also considered positive factors for Vinhomes' growth. Despite some foreign investor selling activity, the company's substantial land holdings and financial strength, along with successful sales, are driving strong investor sentiment and a surge in its stock price and market value.

title: Cổ phiếu "họ" Vingroup đồng loạt tăng bốc, vốn hóa Vinhomes chạm ngưỡng 190.000 tỷ đồng, vượt Vietinbank, Hòa Phát, Vinamilk
summary: Vinhomes' stock (VHM) saw significant gains on September 5th, reaching a 5-month high, as the broader Vingroup group (VIC, VRE) also saw positive movement.  The surge follows Vinhomes' announcement of a 370 million share buyback program, aiming to boost investor confidence and potentially increase earnings per share (EPS).  The buyback is projected to cost between 12.7 and 14.8 trillion VND.  Analysts are optimistic about Vinhomes' future performance, citing high unsold inventory (118.7 trillion VND), upcoming project launches, and successful pending sales.  The recent positive legal changes regarding real estate are also seen as beneficial for the company.  As a result, Vinhomes' market capitalization surpassed that of other major companies like Vietinbank, Hòa Phát, and Vinamilk.

title: Cổ phiếu tăng 90% từ đầu năm, giá trị thị trường của 1 doanh nghiệp Viettel đạt gần 6 tỷ USD, vượt FPT, Vinamilk, MB... áp sát top 10 công ty giá trị nhất thị trường chứng khoán
summary: Viettel Global (VGI) stock surged 90% in the first part of 2024, reaching a market capitalization of nearly 6 billion USD. This makes it a top 10 company by market value, surpassing companies like FPT, Vinamilk, and MB.  The strong performance is attributed to a successful 2023, with 19% revenue growth driven by impressive results in several overseas markets, particularly strong growth in mobile payment services.  While the company did experience a slight profit decline in 2023 due to currency losses and provisions, it still reported a profit, marking its second consecutive profitable year.  The stock's significant increase in value reflects investor confidence in the company's substantial international expansion and potential.

title: Nhiều người liên tục mua cổ phiếu Vinamilk
summary: F&N Dairy Investments PTE. LTD., a Singaporean investment firm, continued its attempt to purchase nearly 21 million Vinamilk (VNM) shares, though these attempts have been unsuccessful thus far.  This persistent interest suggests ongoing confidence in Vinamilk's future prospects, despite past failed attempts.  Other noteworthy transactions include CII increasing its stake in NBB to 54.5% and Minh Khang Capital Trading Public (CTP) announcing a planned complete divestment of their shares.  Finally, Masan Consumer Holdings (MCH) announced the final date for registering to receive their 2023 dividends, totaling over 3.946 trillion VND.  The overall theme is significant investor activity and transactions within the Vietnamese stock market.

title: AEON, Điện Máy Xanh trợ lực cho doanh thu Xe đạp Thống Nhất lên đỉnh mới, riêng Vinamilk tiêu thụ 32.000 xe tương đương 1/4 doanh số
summary: Xe đạp Thống Nhất Hà Nội saw a 24% increase in revenue to nearly 177 billion VND in 2023, despite facing intense competition from cheaper imports and global supply chain disruptions.  A key factor in their success was the collaboration with major retailers like AEON and Điện Máy Xanh, expanding their market reach.  Vinamilk, as a major customer, accounted for 32,000 bicycles (25% of total sales), contributing significantly to the company's revenue.  While the company plans a slightly lower revenue target of 162 billion VND for 2024, the growth in 2023 and partnerships with large retailers show sustained efforts to adapt and compete in a challenging market.  The company also focused on upgrading its technology and production processes, resulting in tripled production output over four years.

title: “Gã khổng lồ” ngành hàng không vừa có thêm 2 tỷ USD vốn hóa từ đầu năm, giá trị vượt Hòa Phát, Vingroup, Vinamilk và nhiều ngân hàng
summary: Airport operator ACV saw its market capitalization soar to nearly 7.7 billion USD, surpassing companies like Hòa Phát, Vingroup, Vinamilk, and several banks.  This surge, a 30% increase year-to-date, is driven by strong Q3 2023 financial results, with 20,000+ billion VND in revenue and record-high profit of 8.6 trillion VND.  The improved financial performance reflects increased passenger traffic (15% growth), international passenger growth (173% growth), and substantial freight handling growth.  ACV's robust position in the Vietnamese aviation sector, managing 22 airports, is supported by positive market projections.  Furthermore, upcoming regulatory changes and large-scale airport development projects (like Long Thành International Airport and Tân Sơn Nhất Airport T3) are expected to propel the company's future growth and investor confidence.

title: Vinamilk và FPT hợp tác chiến lược nâng tầm quản trị tài chính toàn diện bằng giải pháp công nghệ
summary: Vinamilk, a major Vietnamese dairy company, partnered with FPT to implement FPT CFS, a comprehensive financial management solution.  This strategic collaboration aims to enhance Vinamilk's financial reporting and management by digitizing processes and adopting international standards like IFRS.  The project, initially launched in March 2024, is expected to automate internal data reconciliation, improving efficiency and the accuracy of financial reports.  The rapid implementation reflects the commitment of both companies to digital transformation in financial management.  The partnership is part of Vinamilk's broader digitalization strategy and its commitment to maintaining transparency and efficiency in its financial operations.

title: Báo doanh thu kỷ lục và lợi nhuận cao nhất 11 quý, cổ phiếu Vinamilk tăng liền 4 phiên, lấy lại những gì đã mất trong 4 tháng
summary: Vinamilk's stock (VNM) rose for four consecutive sessions in late July, recovering ground lost in the previous four months, reaching a price of 71,300 VND per share.  This strong performance is linked to record-breaking Q2 2024 results.  Vinamilk achieved its highest-ever quarterly revenue at 16.656 trillion VND, a 10% increase year-over-year.  Profit after tax also hit an 11-quarter high, increasing by 21%. Key drivers were strong international sales growth (18.5% of total revenue, with exports up 37%),  particularly in export markets and foreign branches in Cambodia and the US.  Strong domestic sales growth, especially in yogurt, condensed milk, and dairy drinks, also contributed.  Favorable macroeconomic conditions, including a 6.9% GDP growth in Q3 2024, and a positive trend in the FMCG sector, bolstered Vinamilk's performance.  Overall, the results suggest Vinamilk continues to gain market share, driven by a strong international presence and growth in specific product categories.

title: Vinamilk (VNM) chốt quyền họp ĐHĐCĐ “kèm” cổ tức, tỷ phú Thái Lan sắp “bỏ túi” hàng trăm tỷ
summary: Vinamilk (VNM) will announce its 2024 annual shareholder meeting on March 18th, including a third tranche of 2023 dividends.  The 9% dividend (900 VND per share) is slated for payment on April 26th, totaling approximately 1.881 trillion VND.  Large shareholders, including SCIC (677 billion VND), the F&N group (384 billion VND), and Platinum Victory (approximately 200 billion VND), will receive significant portions of this payment.  Q4 2023 saw strong results with a 24% increase in profit after tax, reaching 2.351 trillion VND.  This marks three consecutive quarters of year-over-year growth and completes a year that saw a return to positive overall profit (5% increase over 2022), overcoming two prior years of declining profit.  Vinamilk's stock price is currently at 70,000 VND/share.

title: Gay cấn WeChoice Awards 2023: Hàng chục nghìn công nhân Coteccons 'máu lửa' làm điều chưa từng có, Viettel Money và TPBank bất ngờ thế chỗ của Vinamilk và Hảo Hảo
summary: Coteccons, a construction company, surged to the top of the WeChoice Awards 2023 "Outstanding Achievement" category, surpassing Vinamilk and Hảo Hảo.  This dramatic rise is attributed to a concerted effort by the company's employees, including a significant mobilization of their large workforce to vote, and the successful completion of the high-profile LEGO factory construction project, boosting their financial performance.  While the broader construction sector faced challenges, Coteccons saw substantial improvements in revenue and profits in Q1 2024, showcasing a strong turnaround following internal restructuring efforts.  The company's success highlights employee engagement and effective strategies for overcoming obstacles.  Viettel Money and TPBank also saw significant vote increases, positioning themselves as strong contenders in the awards.

title: Vinamilk: Doanh thu xuất khẩu quý 4/2023 tăng trưởng ấn tượng gần 20%
summary: Vinamilk's Q4 2023 export revenue saw impressive growth of nearly 20%, boosting overall Q4 revenue to 15.619 trillion VND.  This strong international performance, particularly in export sales (19.3% growth) and overseas branch revenue (4.7% growth), reflects a successful expansion into new markets and effective management of existing ones.  The company saw positive results in key markets like the US (Driftwood) and Cambodia (AngkorMilk), while domestic sales also performed well, maintaining a stable market share.  Marketing efforts, including a revamped brand image and consumer experience events, also contributed to the positive results.  Overall, the results show Vinamilk's commitment to both domestic and international expansion, with a focus on sustainability and adapting to evolving consumer trends.  Furthermore, a significant improvement in gross profit margin and cost control led to a significant jump in Q4 profit after tax.

title: Vừa lên sàn, công ty bán gần 12.000 tỷ nguyên liệu cho Vinamilk, Masan, Trung Nguyên giảm giá trị hơn 1.700 tỷ, tài sản Chủ tịch 'bay' 500 tỷ
summary: Newly listed company Asia Group (AIG), a supplier of ingredients to major food companies like Vinamilk and Masan, experienced a significant drop in stock price during its first few trading days on UPCoM.  The stock price fell by 16% from its initial reference price, resulting in a loss of over 1.7 trillion VND in market capitalization.  This decline impacted the market value of Chairman Nguyễn Thiên Trúc's holdings, reducing his estimated asset value by over 500 billion VND.  Despite a strong Q3 2024 performance showing revenue growth and profit increases, investor reaction to the initial public offering (IPO) was negative, characterized by low trading volume and falling prices, potentially signaling investor hesitation or concerns about the company's future prospects.

title: “Gã khổng lồ” Vinamilk dồn dập trả cổ tức "khủng", hơn 5.100 tỷ đồng sắp chảy về túi cổ đông
summary: Vinamilk announced a substantial dividend payout plan, totaling over 5.120 trillion VND.  This includes a final 2023 dividend of 9.5% and a 15% interim dividend for 2024, bringing the total 2023 dividend payout to 38.5%.  This massive payout, representing nearly 95% of Vinamilk's 2024 projected profit, is set to deliver substantial returns to major shareholders, including SCIC, the F&N group, and Platinum Victory.  Vinamilk's strong Q1 and Q2 2024 financial performance, with a 6% revenue increase and a 19% profit increase, supports this substantial payout.  Despite the large dividend payout, the company maintains strong financial health and a projected record-breaking year with an ambitious revenue target of 63.163 trillion VND.  Currently trading at 74,200 VND/share, Vinamilk boasts a market capitalization of approximately 155 trillion VND (~6.2 billion USD).

title: Vinamilk thắng lớn đầu năm 2024 tại bảng xếp hạng Superior Taste Award
summary: Vinamilk won numerous awards at the Superior Taste Award, solidifying its international quality reputation.  Specifically, 11 Vinamilk products were recognized, including 100% fresh milk in multiple flavors (with and without sugar) and yogurt products. This success follows Vinamilk's 2023 rebranding efforts and consumer experience events.  The recognition comes from a panel of international food experts, who evaluated products based on sensory criteria, signifying a high standard for taste and quality.  The awards build on previous international recognitions for Vinamilk's products, further showcasing their commitment to quality and consumer satisfaction.

title: Công ty của tỉ phú Thái Lan có động thái mới tại Vinamilk
summary: F&N Dairy Investment Pte. Ltd., a company linked to Thai billionaire Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, has made another attempt to purchase nearly 21 million Vinamilk (VNM) shares.  This would increase their stake in Vinamilk from 17.69% to 18.69% if successful.  This is the fifth attempt this year by the Thai firm to acquire these shares, though previous attempts have been unsuccessful.  Meanwhile, Platinum Victory Pte. Ltd., another investor linked to Vinamilk's board, also repeatedly attempted but failed to acquire shares.  In contrast, SCIC, the largest shareholder in Vinamilk, did successfully purchase 1.45 million shares.  Despite the unsuccessful attempts by some foreign investors, Vinamilk's Q1 2024 financial results were positive, showing a slight revenue increase and a more substantial 300 billion VND increase in profit after tax, although cash holdings decreased significantly.

title: Vinamilk tạo nhiều dấu ấn tại Triển lãm quốc tế ngành sữa 2024
summary: Vinamilk made a strong showing at the 2024 International Dairy Expo, highlighting its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and consumer experience.  The company presented a wide range of products, including 100% fresh milk, Green Farm dairy products, and a variety of plant-based options, showcasing their diverse portfolio and recent international awards for product quality and taste.  Vinamilk also featured interactive experiences, demonstrating its commitment to sustainable development through initiatives like a "plant a tree" program.  The company's efforts to meet growing consumer demands for environmentally conscious products, along with its existing international recognition, further reinforce its position as a leader in the Vietnamese dairy sector.

title: Vinamilk nhận loạt giải thưởng về quản trị và phát triển bền vững
summary: Vinamilk received multiple awards for its strong governance and sustainability practices in 2024.  The company was recognized for its significant progress in environmental impact reduction and social responsibility, earning awards including "Best Sustainability Report," "Best Greenhouse Gas Management Report," and "Top 10 Best Corporate Governance Companies (large capitalization)."  This is Vinamilk's third consecutive win for greenhouse gas management reporting and part of their broader commitment to sustainability, including their Net Zero 2050 plan.  The company's reporting adheres to international standards like GRI and CDP, alongside industry-specific benchmarks.  This commitment to transparency and sustainability is seen as a key factor in enhancing their brand reputation, attracting investors, and potentially opening up new markets, especially those with growing demand for sustainable goods.

title: Vinamilk: Thị trường nước ngoài tiếp tục dẫn dắt tăng trưởng doanh thu 3 tháng đầu năm
summary: Vinamilk maintained strong Q1 2024 performance, defying a generally declining trend in the Vietnamese dairy market.  While overall consumer spending saw a slower pace of growth, Vinamilk's revenue rose 1.4% to 14.112 trillion VND, with international sales (exports and overseas branches) contributing significantly (7.7% growth).  This was particularly driven by strong export growth, maintaining high levels compared to Q4 2023.  Vinamilk's positive performance is attributed to the positive momentum in existing export markets, and continued expansion into new markets in Africa and South America.  Improved profitability (15.8% growth in profit after tax) and a growing gross profit margin highlight successful cost management and strong overall performance. Despite the challenging economic environment, Vinamilk is well-positioned to achieve its projected full-year targets. The company also maintained a high level of cash reserves and a low debt-to-assets ratio.  The company is also earning recognition for its sustainability efforts, having earned carbon neutrality certifications for several of its operations.

title: Vinamilk báo lãi sau thuế hơn 2.400 tỷ quý 3/2024, gửi ngân hàng hơn 1 tỷ USD tiền nhàn rỗi
summary: Vinamilk's Q3 2024 earnings saw a slight decrease in profit after tax (down 5.1% to 2.403 trillion VND) compared to the previous quarter, mainly due to rising cost of goods sold.  While total revenue was roughly flat compared to Q3 2023, some product lines saw double-digit growth, particularly yogurt drinks (Probi) and plant-based milk (Green Farm).  The company's significant cash holdings, including nearly 1 billion USD in bank deposits, yielded over 1.041 trillion VND in interest income during the first nine months of the year.  Despite the slight profit dip in Q3, the company's overall performance in the first nine months of 2024 was positive, with a 3.5% increase in revenue and a 10% increase in profit after tax compared to the same period in 2023.

title: Khối ngoại bán mạnh cổ phiếu Vinamilk, “gã khổng lồ” ngành sữa rớt khỏi top 10 doanh nghiệp giá trị nhất sàn chứng khoán
summary: Foreign investors have been heavily selling Vinamilk (VNM) stock, leading to a significant decline in its market capitalization.  Sales are up over 2.5 trillion VND since the start of the year, making it the largest such sell-off in the market.  This selling pressure coincides with Vinamilk's recent struggles with maintaining consistent growth, with revenue and profits stagnating in recent years.  While the company showed a return to positive profit growth in 2023, foreign investors appear less enthusiastic due to the challenges of maintaining growth and market share.  Despite this, analysts see potential for future growth in both domestic and international markets.

title: Loạt doanh nghiệp Việt “đem chuông đi đánh xứ người”: Viettel Global, Vinamilk, Thế Giới Di Động bắt đầu “hái quả ngọt”, FPT "bỏ túi" cả tỷ USD
summary: Several Vietnamese companies are venturing into international markets, with varying degrees of success.  Viettel Global (VGI) is experiencing significant profit growth from overseas operations, reaching a record high in Q1 2024.  This success suggests a potential turning point for the company, potentially leading to dividend payments after years of accumulating losses.  FPT is pursuing an M&A strategy in the tech sector, acquiring international companies to enhance its service offerings and expand its global client base.  Vinamilk is also expanding abroad, with notable investments in countries like the US and Laos, aiming to leverage these operations for long-term sustainable growth.  While Thế Giới Di Động initially ventured into Cambodia but ultimately closed its operations there due to market challenges, it's now exploring the Indonesian market with Era Blue, a joint venture, with positive early signs of profitability expected later this year. Overall, the trend highlights the growing ambition of Vietnamese companies to expand globally, but these ventures involve substantial risks and not all are immediate successes.

title: Giá 'vàng trắng' tăng liền 8 tháng, cổ phiếu các công ty trong nhóm đồng loạt 'nổi sóng', vốn hóa của DN đầu ngành tăng 60.000 tỷ, vượt VPBank, Vinamilk, MB, Masan...
summary: Rubber prices in Vietnam have been rising for eight consecutive months, driving a surge in the stock prices of related companies like GVR (Tập đoàn Công nghiệp Cao su Việt Nam).  This has pushed GVR's market capitalization above 144.6 trillion VND, surpassing several major companies like VPBank, Vinamilk, and Masan.  The increase is largely due to a combination of factors, including high domestic demand, a shortage of natural rubber supply (especially from Thailand and Indonesia), and a rebound in demand from China's automotive industry.  While exports saw a slight decrease in volume in May 2024, the average export price increased by 1.2%, reaching a record high of 1,616 USD/ton.  The sustained price increases are fueling optimism for continued growth in the rubber sector, especially given that China is a significant export market for Vietnamese rubber.

title: Không phải Hòa Phát, VinGroup, Vinamilk hay đại diện nhóm ngân hàng, “3 chữ cái” đang được nhiều quỹ “ôm” có thể khiến nhà đầu tư "ngỡ ngàng" vì tiếc
summary: FPT, a leading Vietnamese tech company, is attracting significant investment from various funds, particularly mutual funds.  As of Q1 2024, FPT was the most held stock by mutual funds, holding a 12.89% share of their portfolios.  This, combined with substantial holdings by large foreign funds like VEIL – Dragon Capital and VOF – VinaCapital, positions FPT as a highly sought-after investment.  FPT's strong financial performance, with projected 2024 revenue and profit increases of around 18%, further fuels investor interest.  The company's recent partnership with NVIDIA to build an AI factory in Vietnam is also boosting its profile and potential for future growth.  Despite recent stock market fluctuations, FPT's impressive performance and strategic moves suggest continued strong investor interest and a positive outlook for the company's future.

title: Tiêu thụ hàng trăm triệu đến cả tỷ kWh mỗi năm sản xuất, chi phí tiền điện của các doanh nghiệp lớn như Hòa Phát, Đức Giang, Vinamilk... sẽ tăng lên như thế nào sau khi điều chỉnh?
summary: Vietnam's electricity prices increased by 4.8% to 2,103.12 VND/kWh, impacting major consumer industries like Hòa Phát, Đức Giang, and Vinamilk.  While the absolute increase in cost isn't significant for all companies, it's projected to raise electricity expenses for those with high consumption (e.g., 2.67 billion kWh for Hòa Phát, 922 million kWh for Đức Giang).  For smaller consumers, increases are likely to be in the 10-30 billion VND range.  The impact on overall profit margins is potentially significant for certain sectors, particularly those with high electricity usage in their production processes, with estimates suggesting potential decreases in profit before tax of 21% (cement), 23% (steel), 1% (paper), and 1% (chemicals). The increase is partially mitigated by some companies' investments in renewable energy sources.  The overall effect on EVN's revenue is estimated to be a substantial increase of about 23.7 trillion VND.

title: Bất ngờ mức lương sếp Vinamilk, Thế Giới Di Động, Novaland nhận trong năm 2023
summary: Several Vietnamese company executive compensation figures for 2023 were revealed in annual reports.  Notable figures include Thế Giới Di Động's chairman, Nguyễn Đức Tài, whose compensation dropped dramatically to 230 million VND in 2023 compared to over 1.92 billion VND in 2022.  Similarly, Novaland executives saw varying degrees of salary reductions, though the overall compensation packages remain comparatively high in some instances.  Vinamilk executives also experienced a notable adjustment in their salaries, with their compensation figures revealed in their annual report.  While the overall trends reflect an effort to manage costs,  the levels of executive compensation are substantial for several companies despite a challenging business environment in 2023.

title: Tập đoàn Thái Lan đang sở hữu Sabeco muốn cầm về 20% cổ phần Vinamilk trong thương vụ trị giá 1,6 tỷ USD
summary: Thai Beverage (ThaiBev), the largest beer producer in Southeast Asia and a major shareholder in Sabeco, is planning a significant F&B-focused restructuring.  The plan involves a share swap valued at approximately $1.6 billion, where ThaiBev will acquire a greater stake in Fraser and Neave (F&N), a Singaporean food and beverage company.  This swap effectively puts ThaiBev in a stronger position to consolidate its F&B holdings, particularly those related to the food and beverage segment. Crucially, F&N holds a significant stake in Vinamilk (around 20%), making this a substantial move in the Vietnamese food market.  The transaction is being driven by ThaiBev's desire to divest from real estate and concentrate on non-alcoholic beverages and dairy products, seeking a more competitive position in those segments.

title: Nỗ lực bền bỉ của Vinamilk trong việc hình thành bể hấp thụ carbon từ rừng, hướng đến Net Zero
summary: Vinamilk, in its second year of a project, is actively involved in restoring 25 hectares of mangrove forest in the Ca Mau Cape National Park.  This "Net Zero Vinamilk Forest" project aims to create a significant carbon sink, potentially absorbing 17,000-20,000 tons of carbon, equivalent to 62,000-73,000 tons of CO2.  The project involves employee participation in reforestation efforts, fence building, and ongoing monitoring, demonstrating the company's commitment to sustainability and its Net Zero 2050 initiative.  Vinamilk's efforts are part of a broader plan to offset greenhouse gas emissions across its operations and supply chain, and are seen as a model for corporate sustainability in Vietnam.  The company's involvement in this project highlights its role in supporting local environmental conservation efforts.

title: Vinamilk có thêm 1 nhà máy đạt chứng nhận Trung hòa Carbon, đẩy mạnh xanh hóa sản xuất
summary: Vinamilk's beverage plant in Ben Cat, Binh Duong, achieved carbon neutrality certification (PAS 2060:2014) from BSI.  This marks a significant step in their broader Net Zero 2050 initiative.  The certification covers Scope 1 and 2 emissions.  The achievement is attributed to a combination of reducing emissions through operational efficiencies and maintaining/expanding green spaces to absorb carbon.  Vinamilk's commitment to sustainability extends across its operations, including the use of renewable energy, efficient production technologies, and reforestation projects. This initiative demonstrates their proactive stance towards environmentally friendly practices in the Vietnamese dairy industry and positions them as a leader in sustainability efforts.  The company has three facilities now certified in line with its Net Zero plan.

title: Tăng trưởng tại các thị trường chủ lực thúc đẩy doanh số xuất khẩu của Vinamilk
summary: Vinamilk's export performance in 2023 was strong, with revenue exceeding 5 trillion VND and a 4.4% year-over-year increase, contributing to a 0.7% overall revenue growth.  Q4 2023 saw particularly impressive export growth of 19.3% compared to the same period in 2022.  This success is driven by continued focus on key markets like the Middle East, China, Japan, and South Korea, with successful trade missions and partnerships.  Vinamilk is expanding its product portfolio for these markets, including high-end specialized products, and is exploring new markets like South America and the Caribbean.  The company's existing production capacity and sustainability efforts are also contributing to its competitiveness in international markets, with products gaining traction in major retailers like Costco and Woolworths in Australia and New Zealand.  Vinamilk's sustained export growth suggests a positive outlook for the company's international expansion in the coming years.

title: Vinamilk tạo ấn tượng với thương hiệu mới và thông điệp “Để tâm thay đổi” tại Hội nghị sữa toàn cầu 2024
summary: Vinamilk presented its new brand identity and "Care to Change" message at the 2024 Global Dairy Congress in London.  The company highlighted its strategic innovations across four key areas: future generations, better nutrition, enhanced customer experience, and sustainable future.  Specifically, Vinamilk showcased the advancements in its Green Farm line of products, utilizing vacuum technology to preserve natural flavors.  The company also emphasized its commitment to sustainability, achieving carbon neutrality at three of its facilities and committing to Net Zero by 2050.  Vinamilk's presentation at the global conference emphasized its forward-thinking approach to sustainability and its commitment to a positive impact on both consumers and the environment, further solidifying its position as a leading dairy company in Vietnam and beyond.

title: Dệt may TCM, FPT, Thaco, Vinamilk, Nutifood… tích cực chi hàng triệu USD thâu tóm đối tác ngoại
summary: Several Vietnamese companies are actively acquiring foreign partners in strategic mergers and acquisitions (M&A) deals.  Examples include Thành Công Dệt May (TCM) acquiring a dyeing plant, Coteccons acquiring two companies focused on metal and mechanical engineering, FPT acquiring a French tech consulting firm (AOSIS), Masan acquiring a German tungsten processing company, Vinamilk acquiring a US dairy company (Driftwood), and Nutifood acquiring a Swedish food supplement company (Cawells). These moves aim to expand product lines, gain access to new technologies, and strengthen their international presence.  These acquisitions suggest a proactive effort by Vietnamese companies to adapt to global competition, leverage expertise from international partners, and establish a strong international presence.

title: Sau ít năm làm nông nghiệp, Thaco Agri của tỷ phú Trần Bá Dương có tài sản tăng vọt lên hơn 51.000 tỷ, vượt Vincom Retail, gần bằng Vinamilk, Becamex IDC
summary: Thaco Agri, a subsidiary of Thaco Group, experienced a significant turnaround in 2023, transitioning from a loss of over 868 billion VND in the previous year to a profit of 41.5 billion VND.  This positive change, coupled with a 26% increase in shareholder equity to 14.301 trillion VND, resulted in a total asset value of 51.5 trillion VND. This figure places Thaco Agri among Vietnam's largest companies in terms of assets, comparable to Vinamilk and Becamex IDC, and exceeding Vincom Retail.  The company's financial strength is partly supported by substantial debt, primarily from bonds, and substantial investments in agricultural projects across Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia. Thaco Agri is significantly expanding its production across various agricultural activities.

title: Hai quỹ VNM ETF và FTSE ETF sẽ "săn đón" cổ phiếu nào trong kỳ cơ cấu quý 4/2024?
summary: FTSE and MarketVector Vietnam ETFs are expected to rebalance their portfolios in Q4 2024.  Based on forecasts, the FTSE ETF is projected to add Viettel Post (VTP) and increase holdings of SHB, EIB, and VIX while reducing holdings of VND, VIC, SSI, and HPG.  The MarketVector Vietnam ETF is anticipated to add Viettel Post (VTP) and Nam A Bank (NAB), while decreasing holdings of VND, VIC, SSI, POW, SHB, EIB, KDH, and HPG.  One notable exclusion projected for the FTSE ETF is EVF, and for the MarketVector ETF, BVH.  These projections are based on liquidity, free float, foreign ownership ratios, and market capitalization criteria.  The changes reflect the ETFs' ongoing portfolio adjustments in response to market conditions and listed companies' performance.

title: Biến động danh sách các “cá mập” nắm gần 80% vốn Vinamilk: Dragon Capital, Vanguard, các quỹ ETF mua mạnh; HSBC, Prudential, Citigroup, JPMorgan bán ra cả chục triệu cổ phiếu
summary: Vinamilk's shareholder structure saw significant shifts in 2023.  While SCIC remains the largest shareholder (36%),  foreign investors' total ownership decreased slightly (53.9% vs. 55.6% in 2022).  Notable changes include several prominent foreign funds increasing their holdings, including Fubon FTSE Vietnam ETF and Vaneck Vietnam ETF.  Conversely, other large foreign investors like HSBC, Prudential, Citigroup, and JPMorgan reduced their stakes.  The overall trend reflects shifting investor sentiment towards the company, potentially due to Vinamilk's slower revenue and profit growth after a period of rapid expansion.  Despite some positive developments, like a return to positive profit growth in 2023,  the ongoing selling pressure from foreign investors suggests continued uncertainty and concern about Vinamilk's future growth prospects.

title: Cổ phiếu Vinamilk bất ngờ giao dịch bùng nổ, “gã khổng lồ” ngành sữa nổi sóng trở lại?
summary: Vinamilk's stock (VNM) experienced a significant surge in trading volume and price, reaching a 3-month high of 70,000 VND per share.  This surge is likely linked to positive Q4 2023 financial results, with a return to profit growth (24% increase YoY) and improved gross profit margins (42.5%).  The renewed investor interest is also connected to broader market expectations of a rebound in consumer spending in 2024, driven by a positive economic outlook following the shift in US and European monetary policy.  Analysts anticipate continued growth in 2024, with projections for 5.6% revenue growth and 14% profit growth.  Furthermore, the upcoming listing of Mộc Châu Milk (MCM) on the HoSE could potentially enhance Vinamilk's valuation, given Vinamilk's significant ownership stake.  However, analysts also point out potential risks, such as competition and input costs, that could affect future profitability.

title: Cổ phiếu tăng bốc, "vua nha đam" chào đón cổ đông lớn mới là "trùm" chuyên bán nguyên liệu cho Vinamilk, Masan, Unilever...
summary: AIG, a major ingredient supplier to companies like Vinamilk and Masan, became a significant shareholder in GCF ("King of Aloe Vera"), purchasing over 2.1 million shares for 6.99% of the company's stock.  This acquisition follows recent shareholder shifts at GCF, including the divestment of a large stake by VCAM.  The price of GCF stock has increased by about 38% since April, potentially buoyed by AIG's investment and GCF's own growth plans, including a projected 21% revenue increase and doubled profit in 2024.  AIG's existing network of ingredient supply companies strengthens GCF's position in the Vietnamese food and beverage sector.

title: Những câu nói của bà Mai Kiều Liên làm nên “chất” Vinamilk
summary: This article highlights the impactful leadership of Mai Kieu Lien, CEO of Vinamilk, emphasizing her visionary and decisive approach to business.  It recounts key moments in Vinamilk's history, including the company's early success in establishing a domestic dairy industry, its expansion into international markets, and its innovative approach to sustainability, exemplified by its commitment to Net Zero by 2050 and achieving carbon neutrality at several facilities.  The article emphasizes Lien's personal commitment to quality, affordability, and service as core principles, as well as her proactive strategy to adapt to changing consumer trends and market demands.  The narrative also touches upon Vinamilk's significant investment in human capital development and its focus on building a strong internal talent pool.  Ultimately, the article portrays Lien as a powerful and inspiring leader who has consistently driven Vinamilk's success and positioned it as a prominent Vietnamese and global brand.

title: Tập đoàn 200 tuổi đến từ Hong Kong: Nắm lượng cổ phiếu REE, Vinamilk, THACO trị giá hơn 2 tỷ USD, sở hữu nhiều tòa văn phòng đắc địa tại Hà Nội, có lợi ích tại các chuỗi Starbucks, KFC Vietnam...
summary: Jardine Matheson, a Hong Kong-based conglomerate established in 1832, holds significant stakes in several Vietnamese companies, including REE, Vinamilk, and THACO, totaling investments worth over $2 billion.  Their holdings in these companies, along with investments in real estate (e.g., Hong Kong Land's properties in Hanoi), cement (Siam City Cement), and even fast-food franchises (KFC, Starbucks), illustrate their diverse and substantial presence in the Vietnamese market.  Though some investments were made years ago, notably their 10% stake in Vinamilk, they remain active in the Vietnamese market, and further investment is likely in the future.

title: FPT trước khi trở thành "ông lớn công nghệ": Hợp tác với Vinamilk làm bột dinh dưỡng, mua đến 90% cổ phần một hợp tác xã may
summary: Before its rise as a tech giant, FPT engaged in ventures in textiles and food processing.  In the 1990s, FPT briefly dabbled in exporting clothing and attempted to develop a quinoa-based nutritional product (Ridielac H.V) in partnership with Vinamilk.  However, both ventures ultimately failed due to inexperience in managing the respective businesses.  These past experiences, as detailed in FPT's 35th-anniversary book, are now cited as crucial learning experiences that shaped FPT's focus on technology and its eventual success in the IT sector. The article highlights that these early missteps contributed to FPT's current position as a leading Vietnamese tech company.

title: Vinamilk cầm gần 1 tỷ USD tiền mặt và tiền gửi, tăng trưởng dương quý thứ 3 liên tục
summary: Vinamilk reported strong Q4 2023 results, showing a 24% increase in profit to 2.351 trillion VND.  This marks the third consecutive quarter of positive year-over-year profit growth.  Key factors driving this success were a significant improvement in gross profit margin (up to 42.5%) due to lower cost of goods sold and favorable input costs.  Total revenue for the quarter was slightly up (15.630.5 trillion VND).  Domestic sales remained strong (over 50.6 trillion VND).  Importantly, Vinamilk held a substantial cash balance (23.199 trillion VND, including significant bank deposits), generating 1.54 trillion VND in interest income.  Overall, Vinamilk's financial health and performance were robust in Q4 2023, supporting their positive outlook for the coming year.

title: Đang thu chục nghìn tỷ từ bán hàng cho Vinamilk, TH, True Milk, Masan,..., doanh nghiệp vừa lên sàn chứng khoán bất ngờ muốn đổi nghề
summary: Newly listed ingredient supplier Asia Group (AIG) is seeking shareholder approval to change its business focus, despite recent negative stock performance.  The company's stock price has fallen by 18% since its UPCoM debut, with a corresponding decrease in market capitalization.  AIG supplies ingredients to major food companies like Vinamilk, TH, and Masan.  Despite strong Q3 2024 financial results, the planned change in business strategy suggests possible investor concerns or a shift in the company's long-term direction.

title: SECOMM – Đối tác phát triển hệ thống thương mại điện tử mới cho Vinamilk
summary: SECOMM, a provider of e-commerce solutions, partners with businesses to develop comprehensive online platforms.  The company specializes in providing Magento (Adobe Commerce), Shopify, and other leading e-commerce platforms, offering services from consulting to development, operation, and marketing.  SECOMM has a strong international presence, including projects in Vietnam, Australia, Singapore, and the U.S.  A notable project is developing Vinamilk's e-commerce website using Shopify Plus.  The company also emphasizes its commitment to client success through customized solutions, ensuring smooth operation and continuous improvement.

title: Vinamilk lần đầu tiên thay Kế toán trưởng sau 20 năm
summary: Vinamilk announced a change in its accounting leadership, replacing Lê Thành Liêm as Chief Accountant with Huỳnh Thị Phương Lan.  Lan, previously head of the accounting department for sales and operations, takes over the role starting July 1, 2024.  Liêm, who held four positions at Vinamilk (including Chief Financial Officer and Chief Accountant), is stepping down from the Chief Accountant position.  This marks the first change in the Chief Accountant role at Vinamilk in over 20 years.

title: Tập đoàn từng chi hàng tỷ USD đầu tư vào Vinamilk và THACO được chấp thuận chào mua công khai REE với giá cao hơn cả đỉnh lịch sử
summary: Platinum Victory, a subsidiary of Jardine Cycle & Carriage (a large Hong Kong-based conglomerate), is seeking to increase its stake in REE (Cơ Điện Lạnh) by purchasing an additional 4 million shares.  This would bring their ownership to 35.7% of REE's shares, making them the largest shareholder.  The offer price of 80,000 VND/share is higher than REE's recent historical peak and is a significant investment.  This investment reflects Jardine Cycle & Carriage's established presence in the Vietnamese market, with previous investments in Vinamilk and THACO.  Their overall investment in Vietnamese companies is valued at over 2.8 trillion VND.

title: BCTC quý 3/2024 tối 30/10: Hoa Sen và BSR lỗ lớn, Vinhomes, PV Gas, ACV, Vinamilk, Novaland... cùng dàn DN lớn ồ ạt công bố
summary: Q3 2024 financial results for many large Vietnamese companies were released on October 30th, showing a mixed bag.  While some, like Vinhomes and PV Gas, saw strong growth, others experienced significant declines.  Vinamilk's profit after tax was slightly down, though revenue was roughly flat.  Hoa Sen reported a substantial loss,  and Bình Sơn Petrochemical (BSR) experienced its first loss in four years.  Other companies, including TPBank, SHB, ACV, and Novaland, saw varying degrees of profit growth or stability.  The results highlight a complex economic picture, with some companies successfully navigating challenges while others struggled, likely affected by factors like input costs and macroeconomic conditions.

title: Không hổ danh là “vua quảng cáo” tiêu 3 tỷ/ngày, tỷ lệ chọi cho vị trí Marketing tại Vinamilk là 1:150, khó hơn đại học Top đầu Việt Nam
summary: Vinamilk, known for its significant marketing spend (over 3 billion VND per day in 2019, though likely less now), faces a highly competitive job market for marketing roles.  A 1:150 applicant-to-position ratio for a marketing role at Vinamilk is notable, exceeding the competition for top university spots in Vietnam.  Despite a challenging overall dairy market in 2023, Vinamilk showed positive results, with record-high Q4 2023 profits and a return to year-over-year profit growth.  Strong domestic sales, particularly in yogurt, condensed milk, and dairy drinks, offset declines in other categories.  International sales also grew, indicating a successful strategy combining brand repositioning with market expansion.  Overall, Vinamilk's financial health, large market share, and robust marketing efforts are key to its sustained success and positive investor outlook.

title: Cổ phiếu bán lẻ, hàng tiêu dùng trong cuộc đua hút tiền: MWG, FRT, PNJ bứt phá mạnh, VNM, MSN, SAB mới bắt đầu nóng máy
summary: Retail and consumer staples stocks saw strong gains in the first half of 2024, attracting significant investor interest.  Companies like Thế Giới Di Động (MWG), FPT Retail (FRT), and PNJ experienced substantial price increases (60-70% for MWG and FRT, and nearly 30% for PNJ)  due to increased investor confidence.  This positive trend is partly attributed to government stimulus measures and an economic recovery, boosting consumer spending.  Companies like Vinamilk (VNM), Masan (MSN), and Sabeco (SAB) also saw double-digit growth in their stock prices, showing a recovery in investor interest in previously "dormant" consumer staples.  Overall, the recovery suggests a positive outlook for the retail and consumer staples sectors in Vietnam's stock market, with potential for further gains in the second half of 2024, as well as potential large IPOs from major players in the retail sector.

title: Doanh thu quý II/2024 của Vinamilk lập đỉnh mới
summary: Vinamilk's Q2 2024 revenue reached a record high of 16.665 trillion VND, exceeding previous highs and marking its best quarter ever.  This significant growth was driven by strong performance in both domestic and international markets, with export revenue increasing by 37% year-over-year.  Overseas branches also saw strong growth, contributing to the overall positive results.  The company's gross profit margin improved by two percentage points, further enhancing profitability.  Profit after tax for Q2 2024 was 2.695 trillion VND, a substantial increase, and the company maintained a healthy balance sheet with a low debt-to-asset ratio.  These results showcase continued success in adapting to market trends, driving product innovation, and expanding into new markets.  Vinamilk's sustained leadership in the Vietnamese dairy market and proactive strategies are evident in their continued positive results.

title: Cập nhật BCTC quý 2/2024 tối 30/7: Lợi nhuận của MWG, Vinamilk lên cao nhất chục quý, Sacombank, REE, Cen Land, PV Gas... cùng nhiều DN 'ào ạt' công bố
summary: Q2 2024 financial results from many large Vietnamese companies show mixed results.  Several companies, including Vinamilk (record profit of over 3.3 trillion VND), Thế Giới Di Động (MWG with a significant profit increase, and highest in nine quarters), and  MBB (a notable 23% profit growth), reported strong performances.  However, others like REE saw a decline in profit, reaching a 11-quarter low, and Hoa Sen had a substantial loss.  The overall picture indicates a diverse performance landscape, with some companies experiencing strong growth while others face challenges, potentially impacted by varying market conditions and internal factors.

title: Vinamilk 16 năm liền là thương hiệu quốc gia nhờ chất lượng, sáng tạo và bền vững
summary: Vinamilk, a leading Vietnamese dairy company, was recognized as a National Brand for the 16th consecutive year.  The award underscores Vinamilk's sustained excellence in quality, innovation, and sustainability.  Key strengths highlighted include leading market positions in various product categories (e.g., condensed milk, yogurt), a robust international presence in over 60 countries, and a demonstrable commitment to sustainability initiatives like carbon neutrality at several facilities, aligning with its Net Zero 2050 goal.  This long-term commitment to both domestic and international markets, with a focus on environmentally responsible practices, is a key factor in maintaining their leading position and global recognition.

title: Cổ phiếu “gã khổng lồ” Vinamilk bất ngờ nổi sóng, ghi nhận điều chưa từng có trong lịch sử
summary: Vinamilk's stock (VNM) experienced a significant surge in late July 2024, reaching a 5-month high and a record trading volume.  This strong performance is linked to robust Q2 2024 financial results, with record revenue of 16.656 trillion VND and a 21% increase in profit after tax.  Favorable macroeconomic indicators, like a strengthening domestic economy, and Vinamilk's successful brand repositioning strategy are contributing to the positive stock performance.  Foreign investors also increased their purchases of VNM stock, adding to the bullish sentiment.  Analysts predict continued growth, with projected 2024 figures exceeding 2023 results, driven by improved margins and the potential revival of large-scale projects.
